title: Watch: Fraser Minten scores game-sealing goal for Bruins against his former team
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Fraser Minten scored a crucial goal for the Boston Bruins in their 5-3 win against the Toronto Maple Leafs.
Minten, traded from Toronto, netted his third goal of the season, securing a sixth consecutive win for Boston.
Bruins coach Marco Sturm praised Minten as 'the best player on the ice' after the game-ending goal.

title: Bruins legend Zdeno Chara describes ‘surreal’ induction into Hockey Hall of Fame
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Zdeno Chara was inducted into the Hockey Hall of Fame in Toronto as part of the 2025 class.
Chara received his Hall of Fame ring on Saturday, and the official induction ceremony takes place on Monday.
Chara, a longtime Boston Bruins captain and Stanley Cup champion, shared the moment with fellow inductee Joe Thornton.

title: What insiders are predicting for the Red Sox in free agency this offseason
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Red Sox expected to pursue top free agents, including Alex Bregman, Kyle Schwarber, and Pete Alonso, despite varying predictions on signings.
Boston has $219 million committed to payroll for next season, about $45 million below second luxury tax threshold.
Insiders suggest Red Sox might target pitcher Dylan Cease and Japanese slugger Munetaka Murakami to bolster roster depth.

title: Review & setlist: John Legend was a legendary pro at MGM Fenway (and he knew it)
author: Marc Hirsh
bullets: John Legend performed at MGM Music Hall at Fenway on Nov. 7, marking 20 years since his debut album 'Get Lifted.'
Legend's setlist included hits like 'Prelude,' covers like 'Heaven,' and 'All Of Me' during an encore performance.
The concert showcased Legend's versatility, mixing soulful R&B, gospel influences, and personal anecdotes from his career journey.

title: Jaylen Brown seemingly criticizes officiating again following Celtics’ loss to Magic
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jaylen Brown criticized officiating after the Celtics' 123-110 loss to the Magic, following previous remarks about refereeing.
Brown stopped short of direct criticism but implied officials influenced his performance against the Magic in the fourth quarter.
After a missed call against the Jazz, the NBA acknowledged the error; Brown was not fined for his prior comments.

title: 5 things to know about Buccaneers ahead of Sunday’s game vs. Patriots
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Baker Mayfield leads the Buccaneers with a 6-2 record, ranking high in deep passing efficiency.
Buccaneers rookie Emeka Egbuka has 562 receiving yards and five TDs, maintaining a strong deep pass connection with Mayfield.
The Buccaneers' defense, led by Vita Vea and Jamel Dean, ranks seventh in defensive DVOA this season.

title: Patriots’ return to relevance includes appearance by Jim Nantz in TV booth to call game for CBS
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Jim Nantz and Tony Romo will call Sunday's Patriots-Buccaneers game on CBS, their first Patriots game in over two years.
The Patriots' improved performance, led by quarterback Drake Maye and coach Mike Vrabel, gains high-profile attention from CBS's top announcing team.
Jim Nantz expressed excitement for covering Drake Maye's game, noting their pre-existing relationship through shared agent Alan Zucker.

title: Magic pull away, beat Celtics despite another big Jaylen Brown game: 8 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: Jaylen Brown scored 32 points but the Celtics lost 123-110 to the Magic, their first NBA Cup defeat.
Magic capitalized on three-point shooting, making 17-for-36, while the Celtics struggled from beyond the arc.
Payton Pritchard found his shooting form, hitting 5-for-8 from three, contributing 27 points for the Celtics.

title: Public reprimand recommended for judge accused of helping immigrant escape ICE
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Judge Shelley Joseph faces a public reprimand for creating 'appearance of impropriety' in a 2018 ICE-related case.
A hearing officer found Judge Joseph was unaware of a defendant's plan to evade ICE arrest at Newton Courthouse.
Federal charges against Joseph were dropped in 2022; she agreed to a state investigation into the misconduct allegations.

title: Alex Cora still high on Red Sox’ future a month after being eliminated by Yankees
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Red Sox manager Alex Cora remains optimistic about the team's future despite their postseason loss to the Yankees.
Boston Red Sox's offseason includes Trevor Story opting in, Alex Bregman opting out, and free agency beginning.
Injuries and trades led to roster changes, but young players like Roman Anthony showed promise for Red Sox's future.
